intro: Capnites peduncularis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and blooms in late spring to early summer. Its flowers are usually blue to violet in color, with five petals that are reflexed at the edges. Capnites peduncularis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and borders.
